column4: Is there any way to stop windows from automatically coming to the front when you click on them? Can I change it so I have to double-click them to make them come to the front or something? It's really annoying only being able to work on the front-most window
Damn, so Gnome doesn't have the option, I might check out KDE
The option for windows NOT to automatically come to the front when you single-click them
It's as bad as MS Windows
I don't want it to come to the front
I don't know what compiz is
Seems a pretty limited GUI system if it forces the active window to come to the front
you could use fluxbox sticky function but that aint really solving the problem just patching it up

This is an example of what I'd like to do. I'd like to have X-Chat full-screen, chatting away, but I want to have an aMSN window sitting on top, or a video sitting on top, and still keep typing in X-Chat while the other window stays above the X-Chat window
But every time I click on X-Chat to type in it, it comes to the front and covers those windows
The only way around it is to NOT have any windows full-screen
Thanks, I'll look into it
I have the "medium" eyecandy settings
i aint too sure you can do that unless what other people are suggesting using compiz
Okay, thanks. I'm glad there's an "Always On Top" option
It's not what I wanted, but it's better than nothing
either that or get yourself a tilting wm but that is probably something you dont want to mess with
It'll essentially do what I want it to do
But it just requires extra effort every time
I have a feeling not many people understand what I mean because they've all grown up with GUIs that never gave you the option of not automatically bringing every active app to the top
Windows and MacOS have always done it, so I suppose when they were coming Gnome they just copied the method
AmigaOS is the only one I've seen that manages its windows properly
I do but not sure its possible the normal way, i have given you suggestion of ways that might do something similar to what you might need, also check the forums and google
